text: On tap at brewery. Black color, tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, saaz hops. Well balanced, very good.

On tap, @Kláterní Pivovar Strahov, Praga. Viaje 03/2017
Color marron oscuro corona de espuma beige, el sabor es a regaliz con notas maltosas y dulce, cuerpo medio, agradable.

Pite 21.02.2017
Aromat głównie słodowo-lagerowy. W smaku praktycznie tak samo, dochodzi odrobina kawy.

Tap at the brewpub. Poured a clear dark brown with a frothy long lasting off white head. The aroma is creamy caramel fudgy roasty malt. The flavour is moderate bitter with a dry smoky coffee charcoal palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Keg at the brewery. Pours black, nose is chocolate, caramel, liquorice, taste is sweet, roasted, chewy toffee, light fruit.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2016 500 ml bottle shared by a friend, thanks Ben! Top 3 dunkel! Dark amber brown with beige head. Aromas of grains, roast, wheat, corn. Tastes of grains, light roast, corn, caramel. Light body with a dry finish. Sounds like its better on tap.
Tap @Kláterní Pivovar Strahov, Prague. Pours dark brown, off white head. Nose is vegetables and malts. Taste is chocolate with a slightly sweet finish.
Горький, резкий, холодны& без особых впечатл&
Tap at brewery. Dark brown color, thick beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, caramel, light coffee. Taste is decent sweet, roasty, dark chocolate, solid hoppy finish. Nice
Nagy, tartós, bézs hab, fekete szín. Karamelles, pörkölt malátás illat. Pörkölt malátás, kissé karamelles, közepes szénsavval, picit édeskés, közepesen keserű. Testes, mégis könnyed, finom sör.

Deep brown, low creamy head. Aroma light roastiness, coffee. Medium palate, low carbonation. Dry tasting, roasty with bitter finish. Nice subtle malt overtones, creamy consistence. This is exactly matching the style.
From tap. Pours dark brown with medium off white head. Aroma of roasted malt, bread, caramel. Medium body with soft carbonation. Taste is medium sweet and bitter.

Dark Brown, medium off white foam, roasty aroma, some caramel and some hoppy notes; medium- bitter and sweet; medium- body, rather thin feel, average carbonation, long slightly dry finish;
Overall: highly drinkable, without flaws, very good beer
Tap @ the brewery. Huge creamy head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chocolate, coffee, licorice and has a smooth dry finish. Nice.

From tap. Pours almost black with an off white head. Aroma of roasted malts, light licorice, bread and caramel, dark stone fruits. Taste is roasted malts, balanced bitterness, light licorice, notes of coffee, stone fruits, bread and caramel. Perfectly balanced and easy drinking. Im shocked at how amazing this is, and glad that I got to share the experience with some awesome people. I will be dreaming of this beer for a while!

Tap at the brewpub. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma light roast, again chewy caramel, breaddy, a nice touch of hoppy bitternes, a tad more dried fruit than the polotmavy, light licorice. Very smooth and creamy as fuck. Wauw! Never thought this style could be so good.

(bottle 0,5l)
Aroma: Malty, roasty, floral hops.
Appearance: Dark brown-black. Medium, brown head.
Taste: Medium sweet, malty, very light roasty, floral hops.
Palate: Medium body. Long dry finish.
Overall: Very nice dark beer. Nice floral hops.

Jan 15. A 0.5 l fliptop bottle, thanks Zrinka! It poured very appealing dark brow body with small brown head. Started to taste it a bit too cold. Showed caramel, coffee and herbal aroma. Flavor was bitter at first, soon balanced and overwhelmed with a pleasant sweetness, like chocolate, cocoa, sweet coffee and other roasted malt. Showed hints of wood, peat and licorice. Pleasantly complex within its medium to full body. Finish copied the flavor, rounding it almost like a schwarzbier, but full and smoother. Needs some warmth to be fully, slowly enjyed. Nice.
Fat på klosterpuben. Mörkt brun öl med ett beige skum. Doft av rostad malt och kaffe. I smaken tillkommer mörk choklad och aningen smörkola.

Bottle 2015-08-15 Göteborg
AR: sour, rosted malt, kriek
AP: dark brown, beige head
F: sour, rosted malt, kriek,

On tap at Strahov monastery brewpub, Prague. Roasty aroma with distinct red fruits, caramel, maybe some licorice and wood. Light, creamy, roasty, malty, develops a woody bitterness and a dry finish. Medium body, soft carbonation. Malty character. Very good.

On tap at the brewpub. Dark mahogany coloured with a beige head. Malty aroma with dark fruits, some roasty notes, dried dark fruits, caramel and herbs. Medium to moderate sweet with nice malty flavours and a balanced bitterness. Smooth, but feels a bit light too, anyway easy to drink and quite tasty.

Draught @ the brewpub. Pours hazy very dark brown with stable, creamy light tan head. Dark aroma of roast, malt, caramel and nuts, with touches of hops. Bitter, roasty flavour, with sweetish malty and estery notes and touches of caramel. Hoppy finish with some sweetish touches. Well-balanced and very enjoyable. A prime example of Tmavý!

Butelka zakupiona w Klasztorze. Po przelaniu pi?kny ciemny kolor. G?sta piana oblepiajaca szk?o. Zapach: karmel, palona kawa. W smaku identycznie. Niestety w budynku w mojej butelce (warka do 14.07.2015) wyczuwalne ?elazo. Generalnie jedno z lepszych piw ze Strahova.

Rounding out the Strahov tasting - I actually passed on trying the IPA and I think one other because I wanted to keep ordering this. Definitely one of the better tmavys in the business. Best of the Strahov set - original and best. Big coffee, hops, and malt - just great strong flavor. A beer with excellent impact. Brought me back to 2010 on my first trip to Prague, when I stumbled upon this place and fell in love. Tasted even better this time!
5.8.2014. Keg at Brewpub. Aroma of sweet syrupy malts, also taste is malty and slightly sweet.

From tap - 0,25l at brewpub. Pours clear dark brown liquid, medium frothy tan to brown head, good stability, Aroma: roasted notes, coffee, malty, dark chocolate, minor smoke notes, very good, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, dry, malty, roasty and smoke notes, sausage - meaty, very good, Palate: medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, long bitter roasty finish, Overall: very good, nice smooth palate, perhaps only some thing, that disturbs me in the aftertaste - in the aftertaste, the mouthfeel gets bit empty/ flat, but the body, bitterness and caramel are ok. I m not able to describe it more precisely.

Keg at the Brewpub in Day 1 of Fergus and Sarahs Czech jaunt. 29/09/14. As specialni Tmave 14 5.3% Served in small dimpled glass. Clear dark black / caramel brown coloured pour with a big frothy light tan head that fades. Aroma is earthy roast coffee, rye bread grains, toasted brown bread and a hint of ginger. Flavour si composed of rounded malty sweetness, toast, little burnt toast, rounded roast. Very well rounded, nice and earthy. Palate is crisp carbonation, fairly fullish body, medium sweet. Decent malty beer.

on tap at brew pub. black, unfiltered. creamy colored hdead. very nice smell of fresh dark bread, hints of chocolate. overall fresh smell. light carbonation. medium body, good mouthfeel, good malt taste, light sweetness and light malt bitterness.

Bottle. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma of chocolate. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Flavor of roasted malts. Dry finish with roasty bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Thanks to Davids sister/mother for bringing this back. Really solid, lightly sweet malty lager with some nuttiness, caramels. Drinks more like an amber lager than I expected from the color.

Very dark reddish brown color. Nice tan head and nice carbonation... fully bodied... Aroma is roasted malt and caramel. Taste is nuts, caramel, coffee and chocolate. Medium dry bitterness. Aftertaste is medium caramel and dry.
Deep dark colour with of-white head and nice lancing. Roasty to buscuitlike flavour. Full body with tones of coffee nuts and chocolate.

Missed it last time, got it this time. Poured a daaaark brown body with a beige thick head that went away relatively slowly. Dry malty aroma, a bit of a letdown, only some miiiild chocolate taste. Mild dry taste, caramel, toasty, ending with a medium bitterness. A well executed lager that paled in comparison to the Antidepressant Ale & the Jantar, but would be the star beer of most brewpubs Ive been to.
Tap at the brewpub. Pours dark brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma is more chocolate and malt than anything. Med body. Flavor is dark malt/darkish chocolate - fairly towards dry - not very bitter.
very dark brown colour, beige-ish head; aroma and taste of roasted malt, some coffee, dark chocolate, and hints of ash; a bit watery; not bad, but I expected more after tasting their IPA and Weizen.

Bleky blek strahov black. Classical taste of perfect Czech black beer. No fault no surprise. On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ pub

On tap @ pivovar Strahov. Marrone scuro velata con schiuma beige fine e persistente. Aroma tostato, di fondi di caffè, frutta secca, luppolo erbaceo. Gusto secco, lievemente acido decisamente amaro. Si ritrovano frutta secca tostatura e caffè. Corpo debole decisamente carbonata abbastanza equilibrata molto armonica

Fra fat på bryggeripuben 8 Sep 13. Veldig dypbrun. Nesten sort. Mokkafarget luftig skum som varer. Aromaen behagelig røstet malt. Smaken er dominert av kaffe med innslag av lakris. Litt tørr i ettersmaken. Kjøpt inn som drikke til maten men ble spart til å være dessert.

Draught
Aroma-caramel, alcohol, 
Appearance-black, cloudy, brown foam, 
Taste-very bitter, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-very good
On tap. Pours dark brown color, nice beige head. Aroma is malty, dark fruits, hints of caramel. Taste is medium sweet, fruity, coffee, dark chocolate. Good one.
Black with a beige head. Some roasted malts, light smoke, light cocoa, dark sugars. Flavor is nice and roasted, light smoke, and sweet malts. Very smooth body and quite full. Very nice beer.

On tap @ Strahov, Prague.

Fresh and malty aroma, some grains. But the grainaroma was in the air because of the brewing activity.
Dark brown colour, brown fading head, minimal lacing.
Roasted malts, sweet, a small taste of caramel, malts, coffee.
Bittersweet aftertaste, medium bodied.

Draft, brewery. Dark brown in color, initially a nice fluffy head. Mouthfeel is a bit clammy and round, with caramel sweetness through middle. Some toasted malt contributes depth. Fairly straightforward, but quite tasty. 3.2.

From tap @Richtár Jakub, Bratislava. Tall creamy brown-shaded blond head. Body is opaque dark brown. Gently roasted dark malts on the nose. Hints of dark caramel and creamed coffee. Taste is much the same. Milk-chocolate, mild coffee and a subtle roastiness. Some fruit- and malt-sweetness underneath. Clean balancing bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel. Light sparkling mouthfeel. Mild bitterness linger in the finish. A treat! [13.04.13]
Dark brown color with beige 2 finger head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel. Taste is light sour and medium bitter. Light to medium body, oly texture, soft carbonation. Nice

On tap at the brewpub. Dark, almost clear enough to let light through but not quite, opaque, brown red pour with white head. Toasty aroma, lots of roasted malt, light fruitiness, very light vanilla character. Taste is quite roasty, light-medium sweetness for the style, definitely not like the cherry coke tmavys from some brewpubs. Medium body, smooth silky carbonation.
Dunkelbraun, fast schwarz. Würziges Schwarzbieraroma. Im Geschmack leicht röstig mit Kaffee- und Kakaonoten, dazu auch hopfig herb, minimale Lakritznote. Überzeugendes Dunkel vom Strahov-Kloster!

Sv. Norbert Special Dark (Specialni Tmave pivo)
.25 L served in mini-stein at brewery in 2011.  Unfiltered variation on a Munich dark, with a little bit drier flavor and is more bitter. All malt, well hopped beer." 

Looks great [4.5]:  Near opaque and black with mahogany highlights; hazy; topped by a creamy tan head that has good retention. 

Aroma; a bit hard to distinguish since the brewer was checking a boil kettle only about 12 M away, releasing a fine aroma of boiled malt. Anyway, the beer itself smelt of dark malt and spicy hops. 

Flavor of caramel and dark malts in about equal proportion with spicy hops. Hints of coffee and dark chocolate in the finish. 

Medium body; near crisp with medium carbonation. 

O  an interesting variation on a Munich dark.

Draught at the brewpub. Subtle aroma of caramel and roast. Balanced taste, light to medium body, rather dry, with a caramelly flavour and an aftertaste of coffee and hops. Although Im not blown away, you can tell the quality of the brewery if you come over and out of the four they have on tap the worst one is this good.

Dark beer 
Sort skum creme tæt lang 
Brændt tømmer kaffe malt humle 
Sød modrat bitter modrat 
Blød Cremet 
6-4-6-4-12
aug12

Keg at the monastery brewpub. Pours a dark Brown with a Red hue and a thick Cream coloured head. Aroma of roasted malt. Flavour also tastes roasty but with coffee and caramel. A touch of liquorice leading to a light bitter finish. Full bodied and delicious.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2013 On tap at brewpub. Heavy beige head, dark brown color. Aroma coffee, roasted malt. Taste initially medium sweet caramel, then medium roasted coffee bitter. Finish is quite long balanced caramel-roasted-coffee. Quite drinkable, A bit low temperature. Otherwise ood beer 6 4 8 4 15.Aroma coffee, light roasted, light caramel. Big stable brown head, very dark brown colour. Taste light to medium coffee and roasted, also caramel maltiness, some hops. This beer has excellent balance. Hops, chocolate,roasted, coffee, everything is there. Really nice.
On tap at the brewpub. Pours dark brown to black color with decent tan head. Aroma is roast and hops. Taste is roast, malt, hops.
Průměrné tmavé pivo. Nazaujalo.  Točené ve strahovském kláterním pivovaru.

(on tap) Dark brown, almost black, hazy. Big brown head, dissipating quickly. Roasted malty aroma. Light to medium bitter, not sweet - I like that. Light to medium body. Hops take some time to spread their aroma. Good, well-crafted.
The head is robust, the colour black. The taste is malty roasty a bit coffee, hoppy, a bit bitter. In the aftertaste it becomes bitter. Nice different kinds of malt interresting! 13/11/10/11/-/11

Bottle from brewery. Very dark reddish brown color with huge beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark fruit, caramel. Taste, roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, some berries in background. Nice long bitter finish. So far the best Dunkel I ever had.

Draft at the brewpub, Summer 2011.  The pour gives a hazy, dark, chestnut-mahogany body with glints of  red around he edges.  A thick, spongy head of beige froth lasts a good long while, leaving sticky splotches of lacing behind.  The nose is of simple, bready, bronzed sugars with notes of caramel, toasted bread, and cocoa.  Theres a touch of a nickely sort of mineral character amidst the dark, malty bread sugars.  Flavors follow suit, bready and toasty, clearly featuring the dark malt with all of its toasted caramel edges, roast, and mildly bittersweet cocoa.  A bit of floral hop character shows on the back end.  The palate sports a moderate, easy going body that finishes with some crisp acidity and lively, cleaning carbonation.  Again, like the other Strahov beers I tried, its not bad at all, but theres just not a ton going on, and it falls well short of other regional brews.
UPDATED: JAN 21, 2013 Dark brown with a medium, tan head. malty with fruity notes. Malt, coffee, chocolate and bitterness. Medium body with a balanced, bitter finish.
Keg	Euston Tap	London.  A nealr black coloured beer with a whitish head.  Sweet caramel and fruits on the nose.  Fruity and bready in the mouth.  A decent length and a tasty dunkel.

Draught @ Klasterni Pivovar Strahov. Rated on 14.7.2009
Sweetish aroma has roasted coffee and chocolate. Flavour has some roasted malts with some caramel and hints of coffee and chocolate. Good dunkel!

9th July 2011Scopeys East Croydon tasting - Cheers Paul! A gusher! Hazy amber brown beer, small pale tan head. Light dry palate. Chocolate flavoured sour cardboard! Dry finish. Pretty grim - cardboard was overwhelming!

Bottle at my East Croydon beer tasting. It pours dark brown, with ruby highlights and an off-white head. The nose is nut, caramel, sweaty sock and smoke. The taste is chocolate, tangy, cardboard, nut, light caramel and toast, with a light vinegar finish. A decent dunkel, but it is perhaps a bit on the thin side.

Bottle at the East Croydon Beer Tasting. Pours a slightly foggy, light brown with an off-white head. Twas a gusher. Bit of dark malts on the nose, some lager and yeast. Light sweet flavor, slightly tangy, bit of toast and roast. Light bodied with fine carbonation. Sweetish finish, some more of this mild tang and subtle roast. Nice.
On tap at brewpub. Brown pour, creamy beige head. Nose of rich sweet malt and caramel. Flavor holds nice chocolate malt, smoke, and licorice, but nice crisp carbonation as well. Yummy stuff.

On tap at Brew Pub
Aroma dark roast character of burnt barley , light some notes , semi dry in character. 6+
 Appearance  dark brown-black , almost clear. Medium light beige top. 3+
Flavor and Palate :  Medium bodied. Mild smoky roast notes. Easy going brew with soft textures. More of Schwartzbier than Dunkel.

Pours a very deep ruby red color with a big head and good lace. The aroma is nutty with a nice chocolate note, but overall it seems very faint and almost neutral till you get your nose right in there. The flavor is fruity and the bitterness is wonderful. The beer has a remarkabally clean flavor and has nice mild chocolate notes with some coffee like roastiness.

Voller Malzantrunk mit passender, aber eher hintergründiger Röstigkeit. Im Mittelteil folgt ein Durchhänger, später nimmt das Ganza dann aber wiederzu und bleibt dann, nachdem eine leichte Bitternote hinzukommt, konstant. 12/10/9/9//9

Nagyon sötétbarna színe van, bézs habja sűrű és enyhén krémes, sokáig kitart. Illatában a pörkölt maláta aromája a meghatározó, kevés karamell és étcsoki is érződik, finom. Ízében a pörkölt maláta már visszafogottabban érződik, a keserű csoki és pörkölt magvak ellenben már fontoskodva jelennek meg, a lágy keserűségről egy kevés komló gondoskodik. Közepesen testes, száraz, lágyan szénsavas, mégis kicsit komolyabban kell venni, kell egy kis idő mire felvesszük a sör tempóját. Soha rosszabb dunkelt!
Very dark brown.  Big thick head.  Chocolate, bready dark malt aroma.  Quite toasty, with a light chocolate undertone.  Smooth - a little soft.  Nice dark lager.
draft at brewpub. Gorgeous! With thick head. Subtle carob aroma and some soft phenols. Soft palate. Lots of nice mild chocolate flavors. Tasty, fun brew.

On Tap at the brewery.
Nice dark beer.  Plenty of foam.  Very drinkable beer.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2010 Bottle. Jet black with a full beige head. Literally jumped out of the bottle, once the cork was popped a gush of beer came out even though it was standing in the fridge for a few days. Light notes of roasted malts. Flavour is much stronger malt with a dry smoky finish. Quite dense and creamy finish

Draught at the brewpub. Pretty, fine, somewhat rocky head on a siny black beer. Aroma and flavor of licorice, chocolate, dry and woody. Smooth body, relatively high carbonation and hopping. Nicely bitter finish with a wood or charcoal edge. Clean and fresh, though maybe a bit boring.

Bottle. Dark brown/black with a touch of red color. Aroma is dry roasted notes along with some burned brownsugar. Nice big beighe head. Taste is plenty of roasted malt and caramel along with some nice leafy/cigar notes. Feels really big for just 5.5%. Finish is really dry and bitter with some dark chocolate and cigar tones that lingers on for a while to make this a really nice beer! Creamy mouthfeel. Carbonation is medium, a bit aggressive but not unpleasant. Luxurious!

On tap at Klásterní Pivovar Strahov on 12th July 2010. Deep red, virtually black with creamy pale brown lasting head lacing fully. Malty biscuit aroma then plenty of burnt caramel and roasted malt, some hints of espresso coffee and a touch of leafy cigar/pipe smoke. Zingy mouthfeel and very bitter aftertaste. I cannot remember this beer tasting so good! (previous tasting September 2004)

Draught @ the brewpub. Easily my favourite of the Tmave Ive had up to now. That one wore a dense, huge beige head that could hold a coin atop its coke-coloured, veiled body. Chocolatey, toasty and gently nutty nose that is surprisingly aromatic for a dark lager. The engaging leafy hops help. The mouthfeel is ridiculously round, yet it feels light, simply enveloping your mouth and never disturbing you with anything resembling agressive carbonation. Top add to my satisfastion, it is dry despite its ample body and just keeps putting on its chocolatey show after you,ve swallowed. Impressive to pack so much in a single pint. Sure the place is expensive for Prague, but that level of quality is rare even among Czech land.

Draught at brewpub.
Brown, ruby color with a tan lacing head. Caramel, sourish yeast, roasted malts and some herbal hops in the nose. Medium bodied one with moderated carbonation, mild sweet caramel and toffe flavor. Dry, roasted aftertaste. Easy drinkable, fine.

On tap at the brewery. Dark brown color with a beige, lacing head. Caramel, brown sugar, yeast, roasted malts and light hops in the aroma. Light sweetness in the taste with a dry, roasted aftertaste. Low carbonation in a thin body. Not my style, but a good dunkel from those I have tasted.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2016 Tap @ Strahov. Pours dark brown close to black with a creamy white head and lacings. Creamy, smooth, roasted, caramel, chewy, vague coffee and butter. Sensationel quaffable and tasty. Nice. Re-rate Jan -16. 4,0 - 4,2

on tap - Kalsterni pivovar Strahov. Dark brown with fluffy, creamy head. Coffe and caramel aroma which carried over to the flavor along with a nice hint of roasted malt. Lighter body than I expected making it very easy to drink.

Draught. Reddish, hazy brown color with thick, creamy head. Sweet caramel aroma with some slight herbs. Sweet caramel in the initial mouthfeel, and some sour yeast notes. Lasting toasted malty, liquorice finish.
Light to medium bodied with low carbonation, very smooth body. Pleasant dunkel.

Draught. High and lasting creamy off-white head. Clear dark red brown body. Sweet roasted malt caramel honey aroma. Sweet roasted malt flavor with carameld and a hint of berries. Low carbonation. Short sweet aftertaste.

Bottle as Klaster Dark Beer.
Clear orange brown coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet aroma of caramel with notes of ash tray.
Sweet flavour of caramel with notes of dried fruits and hops.
Hoppy finish.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2016 Near black with a lasting, creamy off-white head. Aroma of dark malts, licorice, saaz hops and a hint of DMS. Medium dry, malty, well hopped flavour, leading to a roasty finish. Creamy soft mouthfeel and a fabulous balance and drinkability.

On draught at the brewpub. The beer is a nearly opaque dark brown color with a medium beige head that dissipates slowly. Small patches of lacing. Roasted malt aroma with notes of coffee and hops. Medium body with a roasty character and flavors of malt, coffee and dark chocolate. Light hops are present at times too. The finish is roasty with a lingering malty aftertaste. Pretty good overall.

On tap @ the brewery. Comes dark brown, almost black, with a generous tan creamy head. Malty aroma.Complex taste with coffee and caramel, some peppery tones as well. Ends slightly on the bitter side, nice mouthfeel. A must for every Prague trip.

on tap at the brewery, pours dark brown, almost black, with a tall light tan head.  Very light roasted malt nose, had to search to find it.  Dark malt, milf chocolate, and coffee flavors ends with more coffee lingering with light spice.  A great dark beer.

Bottle 100 cl. Courtesy of Ungstrup. Comes as "Klaster Dark Beer (Tmavé 14°). Pours a clear reddish brown with a dense, beige head leaving laces. Aroma of hard roasted malt and vanilla. Medium body, hard roasted malts, bitter chocolate and a distinct bitterness in the finish. 291208

Draught at Klasterni Pivovar Strahov, Prague. August 08. Dark brown with a large beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and licorice. Great malt body with underlying coffee and toffee notes. Medium bodied, great mouthfeel with a sweet and bitter finish. Sensational beer.

Bottled. A dark brown beer with a huge brown head. The aroma is sweet malty with notes of caramel and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of malty and straw as well as lighter notes of caramel, the caramel though gains in strength towards the finish, leading to a dry bitter finish. Thanks to my friend Kristian for bringing this home for Christmas.
On tap @ the brewpub. Almost black colour, big beige head. Aroma of coffee, malts. Flavour is coffee, moccha, burnt malts, hop bitterness. Finish is bitter roastedness.
Draught @ the brewpub. Unclear dark brown with huge beige creamy head. Sweet aroma with butter, caramel and roasted malt. Sweet flavor that holds roasted malt, caramel and butter notes.

(draught, at the Strahov Monastery, Prague) deepest black colour, towering tanned head. aroma has strong notes of roasted coffee and liqourice, mediumly hopped, light hints of tar and charcoal. flavour is smoothly malty with strong roasted coffe, mild hopping and a hint of liqourice. light roasted-bitter finish, medium carbonation and body.

(6/24/08) Draught at the brewpub in Prague. Dark brown color with a big stable beige head. Aroma of toasted/roasted malt, some coffee, light yeast hints and maybe a bit of licorice. Sweet flavor with roasted malt, light coffee notes and some caramel. Medium-bodied. Nice stuff.

(Draught at Klasterni Pivovar Strahov, Prague, 20 July 2008) Almost black colour with creamy, pale brown head. Malty, roasted nose with discrete notes of chocolate and coffee. Malty, roasted taste with chocolate, coffee and cola. Fairly discrete flavours and moderate bitterness. A decent dunkel, but lacking some punch.

Tap @ Klásterní Pivovar Strahov, Prague.
Pours deep black with a giant, creamy, cappucino head. Super duration. Aroma is sweet, chocolate, roasted malts and raisins. Medium carbonation, fine mouthfeel. Flavour is pleasant, well roasted, light raisin fruitiness and soft chocolate. Spicy and crisp hoppy finish. Extremely drinkable.
From tap at Strahov Monastary Prague. ... Deep dark black ... big foam head ... bitter roast malts ... little chocolate ... some coffeee... good chocolate roast linger.

From tap at the brewpub. Pours dark brown, unclear and with a lacing light brown head. Mild roasted malt aroma. Flavour is roasted malt together with a nice liqourice hops flavour. Ends dry and bitter with a nice lingering liqourice spiced hops finish.

Draft at the brewpub.
Very dark brown, off-white head.
Nutty, malty, a little coffee. Some burned toast in the finish. Nice stuff.

Draught. Very deep ruby red colour, big beige creamy/bubbly head. Lots of lace. Aroma is caramel malts, some toffee and mildly rubbery notes. Flavour is very roasted malts, some toffee, licorice and mild herbal notes. Longlasting roasted aftertaste.

Draught @ the brewpub. Average beige and creamy head that mostly lasted. Good display of lacework. Quit black color. Aroma of mild coffee, sweet chocolate, roasted malt. Over the palate came mild hoppy and dusty floral notes. Medium to almost full bodied with an average carbonation. Moderated bitter and sweet flavor in balance. Lingering roasted malty and bitter hoppy finish. Nice crispe and fresh that was very drinkable.

Draft at Strahov Monastary Prague: Lighter medium body with hardly a taste after the initial front of tounge assault.  Not much nose. Weaker oily head with sandy lacing.  A good swashing about the mouthe hepls this brew out a good bit and releases the nutty dark malts.  Some carmelization.  Overall not a bad dunkel.  I mixed this with their weiss and it was Magic.

Well made for the style (more porter for my tastes) but perhaps a bit pedestrian. Light milk chocolate on the nose. Palate shows medium strength sweet chocolate with a sliver of bitterness. Solid if not spectacular.

Back from a Czech Republic pub-crawl this is part of my express ratings for the typical Světlý 11°- (Czech light Pils), Světlý 12°+ (Czech Pils), Polotmavý (Czech Amber Lagers) and Tmavý (Czech Black Lagers).  Non-typical beers will receive personalized descriptions after the express ratings.-------- />
How: Tap at brewpub (Klásterní Pivovar Strahov, Prague)
The look: Black body with medium beige head
To me a typical Czech Tmavé (Czech Black Lager) is: Dark malts and barely any roastiness sensation.  Some dark fruits flavours (raisins with a little figs, dates and prunes) wrapped in smooth dark caramel (borderline toffee) and a subtle chocolate note.  A bit bready.  Moderately sweet without much hops presence and only a mild bitterness (voluntary unbalanced it seems).  Very smooth body, like a watery cream.
This one: As above with a little tobacco hint.  Average.

En fût. Pinte dégustée directement à la brasserie. Arôme: Légère odeur fruité et de torréfaction. Apparence: La couleur est noire opaque. Présence dun large col mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel fruité avec une pointe de café. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement torréfié. (Rating #1513)

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2008 At the brewery. Pitch capped with mountainous beige. Deceptively citrussy nostril with some very English sulphur. Smells almost like a cask golden ale. Bitter hop punch (mandarin,grapefruit) without much malt roast or chocolate. Vaguely smoky, but it could be the choking nicotine. Tasty, uncomplicated, juicily hopped...

Draught, Strahov/Praha.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, light brown, mostly lasting.
Body is dark brown to black.

Aroma is moderately malty (roasted grain, coffee, chocolate).

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Straightforward and plain but decent.  If I hadnt had the Kout dunkel a day or two earlier, I might have liked this a bit more, but it wasnt even close.

Tap at the brewpub, 12-14-07.   Deep brown with a big soapy beige head.   Sweet roasty, woody and chocolate aroma.   Flavor is sweet and malty with low bitterness and a hint of smoke.   Just enough hops to balance, but no more.   Palate is medium, smooth, and creamy.   Very nice dunkle.   "This is a good morning beer; tastes like you could brush your teeth with it." - Adam

Mr. Ostendorf brought a bottle of this home from his Czech visit.  I couldnt help but expect something below average.  He delivered.  Packed with flavor for being 5.5%.  Riddled with roasted/burnt malts - finishes with a rather bitter espresso, dark fruit, hoppy punch.  From my memory of Czech beers during my visit - this one is way up there.  Very good!

I had this at the brewery in Prague and brought two bottles of it back with me to the States. Wow, what a beer. Probably the best I had over two short days in the city. A nice flavor, a bit of hop, not too strong nor overpowering. I polished off two there and couldve had more.

Draft - Dark brown hazy body with a red shine, very long lasting whipped cream head; Medium sized very well composed nose of hop sack, licorice and star anise; Big bubbled carbonation in fresh body, malty and hoppy bitter, very pleasant; Long finish, starting malty and hoppy bitter, becoming warmer, soft licorice, almost chocolaty. Great beer.
Bottle brought to me by some Czech relatives. Dark brown with a thick tan head. Malty and dry with a fair amount of bitterness. A very smooth and elegant Dunkel.
on tap at Klasterni Pivovar in Prague. Dark brown, large head, slightly hazy, as it is unfiltered. Lovely taste with flavours of wild berries, roasted malt, coffee and caramel. Not sweet at all.

Brun/sort Øl fået på bryggeriet i Prag.

Smagen er humlet. Megen kulsyre og llen virker meget frisk. (af en sort øl)

Duften er maltet.
Draught at the brewpub. Black - light brown head. Burned, malty, ryebread, chokolate, light to thin body. High bitterness. Rather simple... but ok !!

Draught at Klasterni Pivovar Strahov, Praha.
Dark brown coloured, huge pale beige head, neutral nose. Light roasted malt and caramel aroma with slight coffee notes. Sweet malty and mild chocolate finish.

(Draught at the brewery in Prague) Very dark amber, great offwhite head. Malty aroma, a bit roasted. Quite hoppy flavor at first but with alot of butter and toffee notes. Vanilla and a bit roasted after a while. Bitter finish, but also with vanilla and milky notes. Some grass . Great balance in this beer!!!

Draught at the monastery/brewery; Sv. Norbert Tmavý 14°Dark brown to black color; nice creamy head. Very nice aroma, delicate, roasted malt. Soft mouthfeel, caramel first, some malt, roasted malt, very harmonious. Ends with some hops, roasted malt, caramel. Probably the best Dunkel I ever tried, for its harmony and elegance.
Thought this was just OK, but enjoyed the brewpub. Lots of malt flavor but no complexity.
Draught  @Brewery. Raost with light earthiness to the malts Drinkable but seems thin compared to the flavours.

Tap at the pub.  Pitch with a little chestnut seeping through at the bootom edge.  Light brown, rich, and lacy head.  Aroma dark and chocolatey, plenty of roast, a little toffee, light hops, maybe a little brown sugar.  Whoa!  hugely potent taste, massive coffee and chocolate.  Herby.  Damn thats potent.  Crisp start; middle is creamy and thick enough to cut with a spoon; end is herby, very dry roasty bitterness.  Soft but full-bodied.  Superb.
(Tap) Pours dark with think beige head. Aroma of coffee and caramel. Taste is very similar with come chocolate in the aftertaste. Smooth and drinkable, easily one of the best beers I had in Prague.
Very sweet, but not like sugar, it was nice to try those grains of barley. The foam was not as impressive.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2007 One of the best dunkels I found in Prague.  Black with a huge, thick head.  Malt aroma, but there is also smoke and meat.  The flavor has more malt and some smoked meat.  Lightly bitter finish and highly carbonated.  Excellent.

Big offwhite head over dark red body that looks opaque black. Dry, roasty, faint aroma. Dry, roasty, burnt taste with lingering sweet burntness as well as some acidity. Not as complex or as drinkable as the amber.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2011 Draught at the brewpub in May 2006.
According to the girl in the bar this beer had 6.0% ABV.
Shady brown color, big beautiful beige creamy lasting head. Served in the small round glasses its a feast for your eyes! Acid and burnt scent. Exceptional taste! Big mouthfeel, good bitterness, a bit burnt and acid, mixed with malts, flavor. Very high co2 level makes it a bit spritzy.8/4/9/4/19=4.4

From May 2005:
Nice darker brew from the monestary brew pub. Actually nothing to do with the monestary part from housing in its old buildings, but still a nice area and a really nice beer.Ar: 7 Ap: 4 Fl: 8 Pa: 3 Ov: 15RerateDraught at the brewpub on June 5, 2011Black color, tan lasting head. Sweet, herbal, spicy taste. Spicy and sweet malty scent. Moussy mouthfeel, medium bitterness.8/5/8/3/16=4.0

Roasty and thin.  Enjoyed at Strahov Kloster brewpub on a hilltop overlooking Prague, a charming city, on Christmas Day, 2005.  The beer could have been thicker, for a dunkel.  Nice beer mugs used to serve it.
Dark brown colour, nice head. Lots of coffee in the aroma. Malty, sweet and rosty with notes of coffee.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2013 First experience on tap at the brewpub, in 2005:

The Lure:Another great head collapses slowly onto atttractive roasted malts, anise-y sweetness and blackberry/blueberry fruitiness. 

The Festivities:The strong carbonation and fruity esters of the yeast make both of the beers I had here seem quite Belgian. Caramel and chocolate caress languorously and roasted malt bitterness and dryness. The balanced sequence of flavors also proffers various fruity suggestions, and a touch of star anise, all the while remaining a comfortable pint to quaff. 3.8/5
Transcendence:Watching a talented sculptor at work.

Second experience on tap, in 2008:
The chocolatey roastiness took the form of earthy tobacco and the balancing herbal hop finish made for a very well structured pint. The body is overall leaner than the usual Czech Tmavé. 3.6/5

Third experience on tap, in 2013:
Dry, bubbly with a few blackberry notes and a beautiful malty finish (not sweet, just malt flavors). 3.7/5

By far my favorite beer during my trip to the Czech Republic which cut prematurely short, unfortunately.  Pours brown/black with a tan head.  Smelled of nuts and sugar.  Tasted of caramel and toffee.  Nice peppery finish.  Wish I could get this one back home.

Very dark brown with thick, frothy tan head.  Like their Easter (Velikonocni) beer, a huge nose that was surprisingly bitter. Roasted, burnt caramel flavor with a dry, hoppy finish.  Best dunkel Ive ever had, beating the hell out of U Fleku.

(Draught at Klasterni Pivovar, Prague)
Dark brown colour, thick beige, creamy head. Sweet, sugary, malty nose. Roasted, rounded malty flavour with hints of toffee. Medium to full bodied.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2005 Tapped, in the brew-pub: almost black, huge dark brownish head, sweet malty nose (caramel), initial dry malty taste, leading to a lasting bitter - chocolate- finish,  medium bodied, well quaffable............

Draught at the brewpub/restaurant at the monastery. Dark brown, nearly black colour. Thick creamy head. Aroma of roasted malts, some leather, hints of treacle. Solid flavour of roasted malts and coffee, notes of dark bitter chocolate. Reminds me of a Baltic porter. Dry bitter aftertaste from the roastiness and hops. A very good beer - good enough to make me go back the next day for more! By the way - the brewery restaurant serves decent food too.

Tap. Sampled at the abbey restaurant, 04/25/05.Black colour. Medium, off-white head. Chocolatey, roastmalty aroma. Chocolatey, roastmalty, caramelly taste. Slightly sweet. Coffeish, bitter-chocolatey finish, which is quite lasting. Really, really excellent. With is biiter choclate flavour and its other aspects it is very reminiscient of a porter to me. This was the best beer I have had in the Czech Republic, so far.

This is a lovely Czeck dark. Some light touches of caramel to start, but it quickly gives way to a a mocha/roasted malt character. Good amount of saazy bitterness in the finish. Nice and bitter, but soft at the same time. Extremely more-ish.
Nice deep dark brown colour with solid head that leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is malty with clear notes of coffee. Flavor is again malty with some caramel and coffee.

Very dark brown, slightly cloudy, with ruby highlights.  Thick persistent brown head.  Malty aroma with a flowery and fruity aroma.  Caramel, butterscotch, some light roastiness.  Estery aroma reminds me of some Belgian strong ales.  Flavour also shows dark fruit and coffee.  Very good.

(On tap at the brewpub) This beer was perhaps the best beer during my 10 days holiday in Prague. Strong coffee-malty aroma. Black-brown coloured with a creamy brown, thin and lasting head. Very smooth taste of roasted malts (coffee), sweetness and bitterness. Little sparkling. Good and well-balanced brew.

Draught at the brewpub. 
Near black. Brown, creamy head. Huge flavour, coffee up front followed up by smallish chocoolate notes. Grassy, malty and well balanced. Perfect bitter finish. Maria took a first sip, said it was lovely, and burped.

Moderately bitter, lightly hoppy aroma.  Creamy light brown head, mostly lasting.  Fair lace.  Black body.  Moderately bitter, acitic initial flavour.  Lightly bitter, acitic (long)finish.  Medium bodied.  Watery texture.  Licely carbonation and chalky feel.
Draught. Roasted, malty sweet smell. Almost black with almost white head. A little anonymous, easy to drink. Light sweet/malty flavour. Long aftertaste with a hint of coffee at the very end.

Back to standard with this dark beer - an aroma of pure caramel!  I was expecting a sickly sweet flavour but was pleasantly surprised by the dryish caramel and fudge taste although the sweetness was still there.  It finishes not sweet or dry but somewhere in the middle with the caramel making a return.  It is improving on every visit, getting less toffeeish and more roasted - just like it's mentor, Flek.  (Draught at Klasterni, Praha)
Cloudy dark coloured, large brown head. Aroma of coffee and toffee. Malty flavour, coffee, liquorice. Bitter finish.
Cloudy dark color, large frothy brown head. Aroma is coffee and toffee, bit roasted malts. Taste is malty, black coffee, licorice, slight tar. Medium bitter palate.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2003 Draught at the brewpub: Brown black coloured. Huge beige head. Theres lots of cocoa and hops in this brew. Fruity accents as well. Is smooth on the lips and has a pleasant mouthfeel. Dry bitter finish with some fruity accents.

Sampled draught at Helsinki Beer Festival.
Chestnut brown with very rich fine creamy head. Rich butterscotchyaroma with some grass and coffee. Sweet and nicely malty - very well structured. Moderately bitter finish. A beautifully balanced beer.

quite a treat and a great place to drink in the old monastery. coal black with a big brown head. spicy aroma with burnt hay. starts out tasting of espresso and vanilla aroma but becomes quite bitter and sharp - grapefruit. very full and with lingering bitterness
